docs.lead_paragraph: The United States last week took a historic step toward the extension of school by at least two years, beginning at age three or four instead of the traditional five or six. This may be the eventual effect of President Johnson's announcement that Project Head Start, introduced this year as a short-term summer program for underprivileged youngsters, will be turned into a permanent part of the educational system.

headline.main: Education: Good Start for Head Start

docs.abstract: FM Hechinger discusses Johnson's announcement; notes success of project in preparing nearly 560,000 youths for let yr of school; illus
